element.name: Date/Time Vital Signs Taken
element.definition: The date/time vital signs were taken on the patient.
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Obtained Prior to this Units EMS Care
element.definition: Indicates that the information which is documented was obtained prior to the documenting EMS units care.
element.v3Comment: This is the NEMSIS Version 3 method to document prior aid.

element.name: Cardiac Rhythm / Electrocardiography (ECG)
element.definition: The cardiac rhythm / ECG and other electrocardiography findings of the patient as interpreted by EMS personnel.

element.name: ECG Type
element.definition: The type of ECG associated with the cardiac rhythm.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document ECG results.

element.name: Method of ECG Interpretation
element.definition: The method of ECG interpretation.
element.v3Comment: "Transmission with no interpretation" may be used by EMS Agency Personnel that are not trained to interpret cardiac rhythms.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document ECG results.

element.name: SBP (Systolic Blood Pressure)
element.definition: The patient's systolic blood pressure.
element.v3Comment: Required for ACS-Field Triage and other patient scoring systems.

element.name: DBP (Diastolic Blood Pressure)
element.definition: The patient's diastolic blood pressure.
element.v3Comment:
Diastolic blood pressure pattern allows for the following values:
1) A number 0 through 500
2) P
3) p

element.name: Method of Blood Pressure Measurement
element.definition: Indication of method of blood pressure measurement.

element.name: Mean Arterial Pressure
element.definition: The patient's mean arterial pressure.
element.v3Changes: Added for additional patient monitoring capability.

element.name: Heart Rate
element.definition: The patient's heart rate expressed as a number per minute.
element.v3Comment: Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate have been merged with an additional data element for Method of Heart Rate Measurement.

element.name: Method of Heart Rate Measurement
element.definition: The method in which the Heart Rate was measured. Values include auscultated, palpated, electronic monitor).
element.v3Comment: This data element was added when Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate were merged as EVitals.10.
element.v3Changes: This data element was added when Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate were merged as EVitals.10.

element.name: Pulse Oximetry
element.definition: The patient's oxygen saturation.

element.name: Pulse Rhythm
element.definition: The clinical rhythm of the patient's pulse.

element.name: Respiratory Rate
element.definition: The patient's respiratory rate expressed as a number per minute.

element.name: Respiratory Effort
element.definition: The patient's respiratory effort.

element.name: Carbon Dioxide (CO2)
element.definition: The patient's end-tidal or other CO2 level.

element.name: Carbon Monoxide (CO)
element.definition: The patient's carbon monoxide level measured in parts per million (ppm).
element.v3Changes: Added to allow use of a new patient monitoring device

element.name: Blood Glucose Level
element.definition: The patient's blood glucose level.

element.name: Glasgow Coma Score-Eye
element.definition: The patient's Glasgow Coma Score Eye opening.
element.v3Comment: Definitions now based on the National Trauma Data Standard (NTDS).

choice.description: No eye movement when assessed (All Age Groups)
Opens Eyes to painful stimulation (All Age Groups)
Opens Eyes to verbal stimulation (All Age Groups)

element.name: Glasgow Coma Score-Verbal
element.definition: The patient's Glasgow Coma Score Verbal.
element.v3Comment: Definitions now based on the National Trauma Data Standard (NTDS).

choice.description: Inappropriate words (>2 Years); Inconsistently consolable, moaning
Confused (>2 Years); Cries but is consolable, inappropriate interactions
Oriented (>2 Years); Smiles, oriented to sounds, follows objects, interacts

element.name: Glasgow Coma Score-Motor
element.definition: The patient's Glasgow Coma Score Motor
element.v3Comment: Definitions now based on the National Trauma Data Standard (NTDS).

choice.description: Obeys commands (>2Years); Appropriate response to stimulation

element.name: Glasgow Coma Score-Qualifier
element.definition: Documentation of factors which make the GCS score more meaningful.
element.v3Comment: Definitions now based on the National Trauma Data Standard (NTDS).

choice.description: Initial GCS has legitimate values without interventions such as intubation and sedation

element.name: Total Glasgow Coma Score
element.definition: The patient's total Glasgow Coma Score.
element.v3Comment: Can be documented or calculated from EVitals.19 (GCS-Eye), EVitals.20 (GCS-Verbal), and EVitals.21 (GCS-Motor).

element.name: Temperature
element.definition: The patient's body temperature in degrees Celsius/centigrade.

element.name: Temperature Method
element.definition: The method used to obtain the patient's body temperature.

element.name: Level of Responsiveness (AVPU)
element.definition: The patient's highest level of responsiveness.
element.v3Comment: Definition changed to indicate highest level of responsiveness.

element.name: Pain Score
element.definition: The patient's indication of pain from a scale of 0-10.
element.v3Comment: The Pain Score can be obtained from several pain measurement tools or pain scale types (eVitals.28). The pain scale type used should have a numeric value associated with each diagram as appropriate. If the pain scale type utilizes multiple indicators/categories the total should be calculated and entered for the pain score associated with the patient assessment.

element.name: Pain Scale Type
element.definition: The type of pain scale used.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document the patient's pain level.

element.name: Stroke Scale Score
element.definition: The patient's Stroke Scale Results.

element.name: Stroke Scale Type
element.definition: The type of stroke pain scale used.
element.v3Changes: Added to include additional detail on the stroke scale used.

element.name: Reperfusion Checklist
element.definition: The results of the patient's Reperfusion Checklist for potential Thrombolysis use.

element.name: APGAR
element.definition: The patient's total APGAR score (0-10).
element.v3Comment: Recommended to be taken at 1 and 5 minutes after the infants birth

element.name: Revised Trauma Score
element.definition: The patient's Revised Trauma Score.
